Please note: spots may be limited in the webinar.[/dfd_heading][dfd_heading subtitle="" enable_delimiter="" undefined="" title_font_options="tag:div|font_size:18|color:%2333d187|font_style_bold:1" subtitle_font_options="tag:h5|color:%23dd3333|line_height:50|font_style_bold:1" tutorials=""]

screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="30" screen_tablet_spacer_size="20" screen_mobile_spacer_size="15"][dfd_heading subtitle="" delimiter_settings="delimiter_style:solid|delimiter_width:0|delimiter_height:1" undefined="" title_font_options="tag:h4|color:%23000000" subtitle_font_options="tag:h4"]A Contrarian Analysis of Market Timers in the Stock and Bond Arenas[/dfd_heading][vc_column_text]In this presentation, Mr. Hulbert will report on the distinct patterns that have emerged from his 40+ year database of investment newsletter recommendations. As expected by contrarian analysis, the markets tend to struggle in the wake of extreme bullishness--and vice versa. Armed with this historical context, Mr. Hulbert will discuss current market timer sentiment in the stock, gold and bond arenas and what it signifies.[/vc_column_text][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="40" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="30" screen_tablet_spacer_size="20" screen_mobile_spacer_size="15"][vc_column_text]
You will learn...
[/vc_column_text][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="20" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="15" screen_tablet_spacer_size="15" screen_mobile_spacer_size="10"][dfd_icon_list module_animation="transition.slideRightBigIn" list_fields="%5B%7B%22icon_type%22%3A%22selector%22%2C%22select_icon%22%3A%22dfd_icons%22%2C%22ic_dfd_icons%22%3A%22dfd-socicon-arrow-pointing-to-right%22%2C%22text_content%22%3A%22Sentiment%20patterns%20emerging%20from%20an%20analysis%20of%2040%2B%20years%20of%20investment%20newsletters%22%7D%2C%7B%22icon_type%22%3A%22selector%22%2C%22select_icon%22%3A%22dfd_icons%22%2C%22ic_dfd_icons%22%3A%22dfd-socicon-arrow-pointing-to-right%22%2C%22text_content%22%3A%22%20Implications%20of%20these%20patterns%20for%20the%20market's%20short-term%20prospects%22%7D%2C%7B%22icon_type%22%3A%22selector%22%2C%22select_icon%22%3A%22dfd_icons%22%2C%22ic_dfd_icons%22%3A%22dfd-socicon-arrow-pointing-to-right%22%2C%22text_content%22%3A%22Analysis%20of%20current%20market%20timer%20sentiment%20in%20the%20stock%2C%20gold%20and%20bond%20arenas%5Cn%22%7D%5D" icon_border="border_style:none|border_color:%2334d288" main_style="style-1" icon_size="20" icon_color="#5e67bb" font_options="tag:h6|color:%2334d288"][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="20" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="15" screen_tablet_spacer_size="15" screen_mobile_spacer_size="10"][vc_column_text]Mark Hulbert is a seasoned financial expert with over four decades of experience analyzing investments and market trends. He is adept at translating complex investment concepts as a columnist, newsletter editor, frequent guest on TV and radio and leader of investment seminars and workshops. In 1980, Hulbert founded the Hulbert Financial Digest to objectively rate the performance of investment advisory newsletters. Hulbert has written a regular investment column for MarketWatch, as well as monthly columns for Barron’s and The Wall Street Journal. In previous years he was a columnist for the Sunday New York Times, Forbes, and USA Today. Hulbert has co-authored two books: “The Hulbert Guide to Financial Newsletters” (Dearborn, 1993); and “Interlock: The Untold Story of American Banks, Oil Interests, the Shah’s Money, Debts and the Astounding Connections Between Them” (Richardson & Snyder, 1982).[/vc_column_text][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="40" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="30" screen_tablet_spacer_size="20" screen_mobile_spacer_size="15"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_separator color="blue"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column width="1/6"][vc_column_text][/vc_column_text][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="40" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="30" screen_tablet_spacer_size="20" screen_mobile_spacer_size="15"][/vc_column][vc_column width="2/3"][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="40" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="30" screen_tablet_spacer_size="20" screen_mobile_spacer_size="15"][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="40" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="30" screen_tablet_spacer_size="20" screen_mobile_spacer_size="15"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1606088710151{background-color: #b5ffb6 !important;}"]

You can help during this pandemic emergency period, 

please consider making a voluntary $10 or $15 contribution to

AAII's LA Chapter. To donate online (CLICK HERE) Thank you!

[/vc_column_text][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="40" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="30" screen_tablet_spacer_size="20" screen_mobile_spacer_size="15"][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/6"][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="40" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="30" screen_tablet_spacer_size="20" screen_mobile_spacer_size="15"][/vc_column][/vc_row]
item.excerpt:encoded: Financial Education meeting information that focuses on the broad overview of basic individual investing in today's market.
